document.docAuthor: Sedghi, Ali, Saboori, Alireza, Akrami, Mohammad Ali & Hakimitabar, Masoud
document.docTitle: Persianthrombium farajii Sedghi, Saboori and Hakimitabar, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus and species of larval mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Microtrombidiidae) from Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus and species of larval mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Microtrombidiidae) from Iran

heading.emphasis:
Persianthrombium farajii Sedghi, Saboori and Hakimitabar
sp. nov. (
Figs. 1–6
)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Persianthrombium farajii Sedghi, Saboori and Hakimitabar
gen. et sp. nov. (larva), dorsal view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Podosoma with a pair of intercoxal setae (
3 a
), with fine barbs, 17 long. Coxae I–II contiguous, coxal field
I 59
long, with two nude setae; proximal seta
1 a
, 23 long; distal seta
1 b
, 20 long. Coxal field
II 52
long, with two nude setae; proximal seta
2 a
, 21 long; distal seta
2 b
, 15 long. Coxal field
III 59
long, with one nude seta
3 b
, 20 long. Two setae between coxae III with fine barbs, 17 long. Urstigma oval and attached to coxae I.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2 .
Persianthrombium farajii Sedghi, Saboori and Hakimitabar
gen. et sp. nov. (larva), ventral view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph: Dorsal and ventral surfaces of all legs punctate. Leg segmentation formula: 6 - 6 - 6 . Tarsi I and II with two falciform lateral claws and a long and slender empodium; tarsus III with outer claw thick, long and falciform; inner claw reduced, empodium long and thin. Tarsal claw 3 - 3 - 3 (dissimilar). There is an enlarged sword-like seta on distal end of tarsus III and a bifid seta on distal end of tarsus III.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Metric data of
Persianthrombium farajii Sedghi, Saboori and Hakimitabar
gen. et sp. nov. larvae (1a, holotype; 1b-1d, paratypes).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The generic name is derived from Persia (country of origin, Iran ) and “thrombium” (Greek, the root name of the Trombidioidea). Neutral in gender.
The species is named in honour of Dr. Farid Faraji (Amsterdam, The Netherlands ) for his great contribution to the systematic of mites especially mites of Iran .

Type material.
The holotype (ARS- 20090502 - 1 a) and paratypes (ARS- 20090502 - 1 b, 1 c, 1 d), ectoparasitic on
Locusta
sp. ( Orthoptera : Acrididae ) (on mesonotum and metanotum (near the base of wings) of three grasshoppers), were collected by A. Sedghi, 18 . 0 4. 2008 in Moorchegui village, Jahrom city, Fars Province, Iran ; 28 ˚ 48.736 ΄ N, 53 ˚ 14.190 ΄ E, 1912 m a.s.l. The holotype and paratypes are deposited in the Acarological Collection, Jalal Afashar Zoological Museum, College of Agriculture, University of Tehran, Karaj, Iran .
